paragraphs.text:
%md

# Spark Core Lab

# Part 1:
### Write a Spark Driver script to find any error messages in batches of logs
* find your dataset in the local machine here: /tmp/spark-ft/YOUR-USERNAME/idea.log
* copy the file into hdfs using the -copyFromLocal command into your user directory in hdfs /tmp/spark-ft/YOUR-USERNAME/
* Create a spark driver script to load the dataset into an RDD
* Transform the RDD to only contain ERROR log lines
* Count the number of errors we have in this batch of logs

# Part 2:
### From the dataset loaded in part 1, write the logic to do a word-count on the content of the file
* Split each line on the space character to get an RDD of seperate words
* use reduceByKey() to combine values with the same key.  rdd.reduceByKey((x,y) => x + y) will add them up.
* flip the KV pair so that A,B is then B,A. This will help us do a sortByKey()
* sort the results by key
* print the top 20 most frequent words in this log file

msg.data:
Spark Core Lab

Part 1:

Write a Spark Driver script to find any error messages in batches of logs

  • find your dataset in the local machine here: /tmp/spark-ft/YOUR-USERNAME/idea.log
  • copy the file into hdfs using the -copyFromLocal command into your user directory in hdfs /tmp/spark-ft/YOUR-USERNAME/
  • Create a spark driver script to load the dataset into an RDD
  • Transform the RDD to only contain ERROR log lines
  • Count how errors we have in this batch of logs

Part 2:

From the dataset loaded in part 1, write the logic to do a word-count on the content of the file

  • Split each line on the space character to get an RDD of seperate words
  • use reduceByKey() to combine values with the same key. rdd.reduceByKey((x,y) => x + y) will add them up.

paragraphs.text:
%md

## Part 1.1: Load the file into hdfs

msg.data: Part 1.1: Load the file into hdfs

paragraphs.text:
%sh

# preview your the file using the path in Part 1 description

# copy the local file into hdfs using -copyFromLocal command

# do an -ls on your hdfs directory to see if the idea.log file is present

%md
